newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela 6-month TEM yields falls to 14.63 pct.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela 6-month TEM yields falls to 14.63 pct.

text.p: Yields on Venezuelan benchmark six-month TEMs fells 37 basis points to 14.63 percent in Tuesday's auction, according to a Reuters calculation using the Central Bank formula.
The Central Bank said it sold 40.00 billion bolivars of 179-day "monetary stabilization", or TEM, bills at a price of 100.17 pct up from 99.27 last week, in its weekly auction.
The bills carried a 14.99 percent coupon. At last week's auctions, six-month notes yielded 15.00 percent.
Out of a total 20 billion bolivars of offered 268-day notes with a 15.27 percent coupon, the bank sold 19.80 billion bolivars worth at a price of 97.21 percent.
For 358-day notes carrying a 15.55 percent coupon, the bank sold 19.05 billion bolivars out of 20 billion bolivars on offer at an average price of 95.08 percent.
Yields on these notes rose 143 basis points to 19.56 percent for the 268-day bills, and 172 basis points to 21.56 percent for the 358-day TEMs.
